attributes.action: I am petitioning for speed bumps or to be made a 40mph zone on the sordale road
attributes.additional_details: In the past 12 months I have lost 2 cats on this road, i have 3 children and there and numerous other children in Sordale, and I don't want them to be hurt. Cars/motorbikes come off the A9 main road and don't slow down coming up the slip road where we stay. We have placed a slow down sigh at our house on the main road, and it's made no difference
attributes.background: Cars/motorbikes come off the A9 main road and don't slow down coming up the slip road where we stay. We have placed a slow down sigh at our house on the main road before coming onto the slip road and it's really not made any difference. We are now awaiting to hear from local councillor.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Speed bumps on the Sordale Road is the responsibility of the relevant local authority.

You can find out which local authority is responsible using a postcode and this website: https://www.gov.uk/request-speed-limit-change 

We understand that you have already raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who all of your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your local council may also have a petitions process - you can find out more by contacting the relevant council or looking at its website.
